summary.para: The GetAllSettings method gets the codec's current properties and writes them to a stream.

param.name: __MIDL__ICodecAPI0000
param.para: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Codecs that implement are not required to support this method.
To load the properties from the stream back onto the codec, call or .

The format of the data that is written to the stream depends on the implementation of the codec. There is no standard serialization format. An application should not attempt to save the properties from one codec and load them on a different codec.

summary.para: The GetDefaultValue method gets the default value of a codec property.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: Value
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the default value. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The specified property does not have a default value.

summary.para: The GetParameterRange method gets the range of values for a codec property.
This method applies only to properties whose values form a linear range.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: ValueMin
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the minimum value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

param.name: ValueMax
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the maximum value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

param.name: SteppingDelta
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the stepping delta, which defines the valid increments from ValueMin to ValueMax. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.
If the VARIANT type is VT_EMPTY, any increment is valid.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The property supports a list of possible values, not a linear range.

remarks.para: The valid range for the property is [ValueMin... ValueMax], with increments of SteppingDelta. If a property supports a linear range of values, the property must use one of the following variant types:

item.description: Unsigned types: VT_UI8, VT_UI4, VT_UI2, VT_UI1

remarks.para: If the property supports a list of values, instead of a range, the method returns VFW_E_CODECAPI_ENUMERATED. In that case, call to get the list of values.

summary.para: The GetParameterValues method gets the list of possible values for a codec property.
This method applies only to properties that support a list of possible values, as opposed to a linear range.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: Values
param.para: Receives a pointer to an array of VARIANT types. The array contains the list of values that the encoder supports for this property. The caller must free each VARIANT by calling VariantClear. The caller must also free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.

param.name: ValuesCount
param.para: Receives the number of elements in the Values array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The property supports a range of values, not a list.

remarks.para: If the property supports a range of values, instead of a list, the method returns VFW_E_CODECAPI_LINEAR_RANGE. In that case, call to get the range of values.

summary.para: The GetValue method gets the current value of a codec property.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: Value
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The property does not currently have a value.

summary.para: The IsModifiable method queries whether a codec property can be changed, given the codec's current configuration.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The value of this property cannot be changed.
The value of this property can be changed.

remarks.para: Any errors besides those in the previous table indicate an inability to process the call.

summary.para: The IsSupported method queries whether a codec supports a given property.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The codec does not support the property.
The codec does not support the property.

remarks.para: Any errors besides those in the previous table indicate an inability to process the call.

Note If the codec does not support the property, the method can return either S_FALSE or E_NOTIMPL. The value E_NOTIMPL is preferred, but earlier documentation listed only S_FALSE, so some codecs might return that value. Applications should explicitly test for the value S_OK.

summary.para: The RegisterForEvent method registers the application to receive events from the codec.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the event. There are three categories of events:

description.para: The codec notifies the application when the properties of the codec change. The event data is a list of GUIDs for the properties that changed.

description.b: One of the property GUIDs defined in codecapi.h. (See Codec API Properties.)

description.para: The codec notifies the application when the specified property changes. Typically, a codec will support this type of notification for a limited set of properties, if any.

description.b: A proprietary event GUID defined by the codec.

param.name: userData
param.para: Pointer to caller-defined data. The application receives this pointer in the lParam1 event parameter.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: Not implemented. The codec does not support event notification, or does not support the event GUID specified in the Api parameter.

remarks.para: The application receives an EC_CODECAPI_EVENT event notification whenever the encoder codec sends the event. To get the event, uses the interface.

The lParam2 parameter of the event is a pointer to a structure. This structure can be followed by additional data, depending on the event GUID. The size of this data is given by the dataLength member.

item.description: An array of GUIDs. Each GUID specifies a codec property whose current value or valid range has changed. The size of the array is dataLength / sizeof(GUID).
A property GUID defined in codecapi.h.

remarks.para: If the codec does not support the specified event, the method returns E_NOTIMPL. The codec might support other events.
To disable notifications for an event, call .

summary.para: The SetAllDefaults method resets all codec properties to their default values.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: The SetAllDefaultsWithNotify method resets all codec properties to their default values, and returns a list of the properties that changed.

param.name: ChangedParam
param.para: Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.

param.name: ChangedParamCount
param.para: Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Codecs that implement are not required to support this method.

summary.para: The SetAllSettings method reads codec properties from a stream and sets them on the codec.

param.name: __MIDL__ICodecAPI0001
param.para: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Codecs that implement are not required to support this method.

summary.para: The SetAllSettingsWithNotify method reads codec properties from a stream, sets them on the codec, and returns a list of the properties that changed.

param.name: __MIDL__ICodecAPI0002
param.para: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.

param.name: ChangedParam
param.para: Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.

param.name: ChangedParamCount
param.para: Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Codecs that implement are not required to support this method.

summary.para: The SetValue method sets the value of a codec property.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to set. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: Value
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that contains the new value for the property.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

summary.para: The SetValueWithNotify method sets a property on a codec and returns a list of other properties that changed as a result.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to set. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

param.name: Value
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that contains the new value for the property.

param.name: ChangedParam
param.para: Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.

param.name: ChangedParamCount
param.para: Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

remarks.para: Codecs that implement are not required to support this method.

summary.para: The UnregisterForEvent method unregisters the application for a specified encoder event.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the event.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.
